post:
![](https://hostup.org/img/logo.svg)
Twitter [@hostup](https://twitter.com/hostup) - LinkedIn [@hostup](https://www.linkedin.com/company/hostup/) - Facebook [@hostupdotorg](https://www.facebook.com/hostupdotorg)

**HostUp's VPS plans are located in the Netherlands and is a perfect solution for both businesses and personal needs. With us you will truly realize what good performance and uptime really feels like!**

We utilize **SSD** storage in **RAID 1** to ensure that even if one of our drives fail your data is still safe. Our memory is also **ECC rated**, and the uptime is high!. You can confirm this on our [infrastructure monitoring](https://status.hostup.org/) page. Along side this we give you full root access & a **dedicated IPv4 IP** to your VPS.

So after our [previous launch offer](https://www.lowendtalk.com/discussion/160129/hostup-ultra-fast-ssd-vps-only-7-year-1000-gbps-ddos-protection-layer1-7-1-gbps-uplink#latest) here on LET we thought it could be a good idea to advertise our more high-end SSD VPS packages (even though they aren't as cheap). Anyways here's the offer!

**LIMITED SPECIAL 2x RAM**
**25** GB SSD Storage
**1** vCore @2.5 GHz
**2** GB ECC RAM
**1** TB of Bandwidth @ 1 Gbps
Voxility DDOS Protection, L1-7

[ORDER NOW](https://hostup.org/billing/cart.php?a=add&pid=45) - $3.5/mo

**SSD VPS #3**
**50** GB SSD Storage
**3** vCore @2.5 GHz
**4** GB ECC RAM
**3** TB of Bandwidth @ 1 Gbps
Voxility DDOS Protection, L1-7

[ORDER NOW](https://hostup.org/billing/cart.php?a=add&pid=33) - $7/mo
LET promocode 30%: LETSPECIAL30

Networks:
[lg.hostup.org](http://lg.hostup.org)
**1** Gbps uplink
Voxility DDoS protection
[infrastructure monitoring](https://status.hostup.org/)

For I/O benchmark you can refeer to @miu's test, thanks miu :)

     I/O speed(1st run) : 566 MB/s
     I/O speed(2nd run) : 697 MB/s
     I/O speed(3rd run) : 712 MB/s
     
     Average I/O speed : 658.3 MB/s

We accept Credit card, PayPal, Bitcoin and bank transfer. We utilize OpenVZ 7 (as for the new features of openvz 7 we support dockers and ubuntu 18.04)
